shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Daily Office Prayers and Litanies (fols. 2ra-17rb) II) Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Ordinary of the Mass” (fols. 17rb-32vb, 35ra-40rb, 58ra-61vb, 136ra-137vb) III) Anaphoras (fols. 33ra-34vb, 41ra-133vb) III-1) Anaphora of the Apostles (fols. 33ra-34vb, 41ra-46vb), incomplete III-2) Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ (fols. 46vb-50vb) III-3) Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 50vb-57vb, 62ra-65va) III-4) Anaphora of St. John, son of Thunder (fols. 65vb-75ra) III-5) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox fathers of Nicaea (fols. 75ra-83rb) III-6) Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom (fols. 83va-88vb) III-7) Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Hosanna-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 88vb-94ra) III-8) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria (fols. 94rb-96ra) III-9) Anaphora of St. Basil of Caesarea (fols. 96ra-103vb) III-10) Anaphora of St. Epiphanius of Cyprus (fols. 103vb-110ra) III-11) Anaphora of St. Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 110ra-119vb) III-12) Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug (fols. 119vb-125vb) III-13) Second Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Christmas-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 126ra-128va) III-14) Anaphora of St. Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 128va-133vb)

donors.donor: The name Gäbrä Mar[yam] is crudely written in a recent secondary hand in supplication formula on fol. 88vb.

dcomments.dcomment: King Mǝnilǝk II (r. 1889-1913) is mentioned on fol. 14ra.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. shows traces of intensive use. The leather cover is damaged. The sewing is damaged. Many fols. are worn and stained with wax (s. esp. fols. 35-43). Some fols. are misplaced: fols. 33-34, 58-61, 134-137. Fol. 58 and 63 have been damaged by fire. Fol. 139 has been cut short, less than half of its original size is preserved. The red ink has faded away due to an unknown influence, most of the rubrics are hardly legible. Tears carefully amended on fols. 16, 67, 76, 80.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Three sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the leather cover (at least 4 tools are used: triple line fillet, double circle, criss-cross, double sine wave with dots).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, one close to the head, and one close to the tail of the codex.

txfolios.txfolio: Fol. 4 is not numbered; fol. 5 is numbered 4; fol. 138 is numbered 134; fol. 139 is not numbered.

squires.squire:
A(1/fol. 1r-v) – I(8/fols. 2r-8v) – II(8/fols. 9r-16v) – III(8/fols. 17r-24v) – IV(8/fols. 25r-32v) – V(6/fols. 35r-40v) – VI(8/fols. 40r-48v) – VII(8/fols. 49r-56v) – VIII(8+4/fols. 57r-68v) – IX(10/fols. 69r-78v) – X(11/s. l.: 9, stub after 2/fols. 79r-89v) – XI(8/fols. 90r-97v) – XII(12/s. l.: 4, stub after 9, 9, stub after 4/fols. 98r-109v) – XIII(8/fols. 110r-117v) – XIV(2/fols. 118r-119v) – XV(6/fols. 120r-125v) – XVI(8/fols. 126r-133v) – B(2/fols. 138r-139v)
Fols. 58-61 are eccentric insertion in quire VIII.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are mostly visible. Ruling pricks are mostly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; incipits and headings of the texts; directives for the ministers and their abbreviations; elements of punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. On the incipit page of Texts I, III-4, III-6 (fols. 2r, 65v, 83v), few lines are rubricated (alternating with black lines). The incipit parts of some of the constituent texts are written alternately in red and black lines (s. fols. 65vb, 83va, etc.).

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡ ቅ(ዱስ)፡ ቅ፡ ቅ፡ for ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ጸል፡ በእ፡ ንጉ፡ for ጸልዩ፡ በእንተ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ (s. fol. 16rb) ተን፡ for ተንሥኡ፡ (s. fol. 134ra) ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡ ለኵልክሙ፡ (s. fol. 134ra) ምስ፡ for ምስለ፡ መንፈስከ፡ (s. fol. 134ra)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The hymn Śärawitä mälaʾǝktihu lä-mädḫane ʿaläm... (“Hosts of the angels of the Saviour of the world...”) is written in compressed script (s. fol. 74ra-rb).

extras.extra: - The title ቅዳሴ is inscribed on the front cover. - Crude drawing, unfinished: fol. 1r. - Crude notes, in ink of different colours: fol. 1v. - Crude notes in the upper margin: fols. 2r, 26r, 27r, 30r, 46v, 47v, 119v-120r. - Crude notes written within the main text field: fol. 9r. - Crude note, in Amharic: fol. 23v, in the upper margin. - Note (possibly a writing exercise), alternately in red and blue pencil: እመስቀሉ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ውስተ፡ ሲኦል፡ ወረደ፡ ለፀባኢ፡ ቀተሎ፡ ርእሶ፡ መተሮ፡ fols. 87v-88r, in the upper margin. - Crude drawings of the Eucharistic bread, both unfinished: fol. 138r, 138v. - Some parts of the text are outlined with a pencil (s. e.g., fols. 34vb, 36ra, 44ra-rb).
